name: wikipedia-screensaver
description: Wikipedia screensaver that displays and reads out the currently edited Wikipedia articles.

scripts.node-sass: mkdir -p dist/css && node-sass --output-style compressed -o dist/css src/css/*.css
scripts.babelify: mkdir -p dist/js && babel --presets es2015 -d dist/temp src/js && babel --presets es2015 -d dist/temp src/vendor
scripts.uglify: mkdir -p dist/js && uglifyjs dist/temp/*.js -m -o dist/js/app.js && uglifyjs dist/temp/*.js -m -c -o dist/js/app.js
scripts.imagemin: mkdir -p dist/img && imagemin src/img dist/img -p && svgo -f dist/img
scripts.build:css: npm run node-sass && npm run autoprefixer
scripts.build:js: npm run lint && npm run babelify && npm run uglify && rm -r dist/temp
scripts.build:all: npm run clean && npm run build:css && npm run build:js && npm run build:img && npm run build:html
scripts.postinstall: npm run build:all && npm run watch:all

author: Thomas Steiner <steiner.thomas@gmail.com> (http://blog.tomayac.com/)
